doc.name: revXMLAddNode
doc.summary: Adds a child node to the specified parent node in an XML tree.

examples.example: revXMLAddNode myTree,theNode,the short name of me,field "Contents"

description.p: Use the revXMLAddNode command to add a node to an XML tree.
The treeID is the number returned by the revXMLCreateTree or revXMLCreateTreeFromFile function when you created the XML tree.
The parentNode is the node whose child the node being created will be.
The nodeName is the name of the new node.
The nodeContents is the text to place in the new node.

The location is an optional argument. If it is not present or if it is equal to "after", the node will be added as the last child of parentNode. If location is "before" then the node will be added as the first child of parentNode.
If the revXMLAddNode command encounters an error, the result is set to an error message beginning with "xmlerr".

Important! The revXMLAddNode command is part of the XML library. To ensure that the command works in a standalone application, you must include this custom library when you create your standalone. In the Inclusions section on the General screen of the Standalone Application Settings window, make sure "XML Library" is selected in the list of script libraries.
